pli-tv-pvr7:1.1.eng: “The things that produce offenses should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.2.eng: The things that do not produce offenses should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.11.eng: Offenses that require making amends should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.12.eng: Offenses that do not require making amends should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.13.eng: Offenses that are confessable should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.14.eng: Offenses that are not confessable should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.15.comm: Sp 5.321: Antarāyikāti sattapi āpattiyo sañcicca vītikkantā saggantarāyañceva mokkhantarāyañca karontīti, “Antarāyikā: the intentional transgression of the seven kinds of offenses creates an obstacle to heaven and an obstacle to liberation.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.16.comm: Sp 5.321: Ajānantena vītikkantā pana paṇṇattivajjāpatti neva saggantarāyaṁ na mokkhantarāyaṁ karotīti anantarāyikā, “Anantarāyikā: but the unknowing transgression of an offense that is a fault by convention creates an obstacle neither to heaven nor to liberation.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.17.eng: Offenses designated as blameworthy should be known.
pli-tv-pvr7:1.17.comm: Sp 5.321: Sāvajjapaññattīti lokavajjā, “Sāvajjapaññatti: faults according to the world.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.18.eng: Offenses designated as blameless should be known.
pli-tv-pvr7:1.18.comm: Sp 5.321: Anavajjapaññattīti paṇṇattivajjā, “Anavajjapaññatti: faults by convention.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.19.eng: Offenses originating from action should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.20.eng: Offenses originating from non-action should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.21.eng: Offenses originating from both action and non-action should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.24.eng: Offenses committed while making amends for an initial offense should be known.
pli-tv-pvr7:1.24.comm: Sp 5.321: Pubbāpattīnaṁ antarāpatti nāma parivāse āpannā, “What is committed during the probation is called pubbāpattīnaṁ antarāpatti.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.25.eng: Offenses committed while making amends for a subsequent offense should be known.
pli-tv-pvr7:1.25.comm: Sp 5.321: “Aparāpattīnaṁ antarāpatti nāma mānattacāre āpannā”ti vuttaṁ, “It is said that what is committed during the trial period is called aparāpattīnaṁ antarāpatti.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.26.eng: Offenses that are fit to be counted as confessed should be known.
pli-tv-pvr7:1.26.comm: Sp 5.321: Desitā gaṇanūpagā nāma yā dhuranikkhepaṁ katvā puna na āpajjissāmīti desitā hoti. Agaṇanūpagā nāma yā dhuranikkhepaṁ akatvā saussāheneva cittena aparisuddhena desitā hoti. Ayañhi desitāpi desitagaṇanaṁ na upeti. Aṭṭhame vatthusmiṁ bhikkhuniyā pārājikameva hoti, “Desitā gaṇanūpagā means cases where, having put down the burden, it is confessed, saying, ‘I will not commit again.’ Agaṇanūpagā means cases where, not having put down the burden, one confesses with an impure mind that is still effective. This confession does not go towards counting as confessed. This concerns only the eighth factor of the offense entailing confession of the nuns.” Vin-vn-ṭ 2005: Dhuranikkhepanaṁ katvāti “na punevaṁ karissāmī”ti dhuraṁ nikkhipitvā. Desitā gaṇanūpikāti desitā desitagaṇanameva upeti, pārājikassa aṅgaṁ na hotīti attho. … Saussāhāya desitāti puna āpajjane anikkhittadhurāya bhikkhuniyā desitāpi āpatti desanāgaṇanaṁ na upeti, “Dhuranikkhepanaṁ katvā means having put down the burden, saying, ‘I will not do it again.’ Desitā gaṇanūpika means what has been confessed comes to be counted as confessed; the meaning is that it is not a factor of the offense entailing expulsion. Saussāhāya desitā means, if a nun has not put down the burden in regard to what has been committed, then even if the offense is confessed, it does not come to be counted as a confession.” Sp-ṭ 5.321: Saussāheneva cittenāti “punapi āpajjissāmī”ti, “Saussāheneva cittena means thinking, ‘I will do it again.’”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.27.eng: Offenses that are unfit to be counted as confessed should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.29.eng: An addition to the rule down should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.30.eng: An unprompted rule should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.31.eng: Rules that apply everywhere should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.32.eng: Rules that apply in a particular place should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.33.eng: Rules that the monks and nuns have in common should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.34.eng: Rules they do not have in common should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.35.eng: Rules for one Sangha should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.36.eng: Rules for both Sanghas should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.37.comm: Sp 5.321: Thullavajjāti thulladose paññattā garukāpatti, “Thullavajja: a serious offense laid down in regard to a serious fault.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.38.comm: Sp 5.321: Athullavajjāti lahukāpatti, “Athullavajja: a light offense.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.39.eng: Offenses connected with householders should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.40.eng: Offenses not connected with householders should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.41.eng: Offenses with fixed rebirth should be known.
pli-tv-pvr7:1.41.comm: Sp 5.321: Pañcānantariyakammāpatti niyatā, sesā aniyatā, “The five offenses of actions with immediate results have a fixed rebirth, the rest do not.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.42.eng: Offenses with undetermined rebirth should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.43.eng: The person who is the first offender should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.44.eng: The subsequent offenders should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.45.eng: The occasional offender should be known.
pli-tv-pvr7:1.45.comm: Sp 5.321: Adhiccāpattiko nāma yo kadāci karahaci āpattiṁ āpajjati, “Whoever commits an offense only once in a while is called adhiccāpattiko.”

pli-tv-pvr7:1.46.eng: The frequent offender should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.47.eng: The accusing person should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.48.eng: The accused person should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.49.eng: The person who accuses illegitimately should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.50.eng: The person who is accused illegitimately should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.51.eng: The person who accuses legitimately should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.52.eng: The person who is accused legitimately should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.53.eng: The person with fixed future should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.54.eng: The person with undetermined future should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.55.eng: The person incapable of an offense should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.56.eng: The person capable of an offense should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.57.eng: The ejected person should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.58.eng: The unejected person should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.59.eng: The expelled person should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.60.eng: The unexpelled person should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.61.eng: The person who belongs to the same Buddhist sect should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:1.62.eng: The person who belongs to a different Buddhist sect should be known.

pli-tv-pvr7:5.2.eng: While making amends, fit to be counted;

pli-tv-pvr7:5.4.eng: Everywhere, and in common, for one Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr7:6.6.eng: This is the summary of the ones.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.1.pli: Atthāpatti saññā vimokkhā, atthāpatti no saññāvimokkhā.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.1.eng: There are offenses for which perception is a factor, and offenses for which it is not. —

pli-tv-pvr7:7.2.eng: There are offenses for which the attainment has been achieved, and offenses for which it has not. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.2.comm: Sp 5.322: Laddhasamāpattikassa āpatti nāma bhūtārocanāpatti, aladdhasamāpattikassa āpatti nāma abhūtārocanāpatti, “The offense for telling truthfully is called an offense for which an attainment has been achieved. The offense for telling untruthfully is called an offense for which an attainment has not been achieved.” Sp-yoj 5.322: Bhūtārocanāpattīti pācittiyāpatti. Abhūtārocanāpattīti pārājikathullaccayāpatti, “‘The offense for telling truthfully’ is an offense entailing confession. ‘The offense for telling untruthfully’ is an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.3.eng: There are offenses that are connected with the true Teaching, and offenses that are not. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.3.comm: Sp 5.322: Saddhammapaṭisaññuttā nāma padasodhammādikā, asaddhammapaṭisaññuttā nāma duṭṭhullavācāpatti, “Memorizing the Teaching, etc., are called connected with the true Teaching. The offense of indecent speech is called not connected with the true Teaching.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.4.eng: There are offenses that are connected with one’s own requisites, and offenses that are connected with someone else’s requisites. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.4.comm: Sp 5.322: Saparikkhārapaṭisaññuttā nāma nissaggiyavatthuno anissajjitvā paribhoge, pattacīvarānaṁ nidahane, kiliṭṭhacīvarānaṁ adhovane, malaggahitapattassa apacaneti evaṁ ayuttaparibhoge āpatti. Paraparikkhārapaṭisaññuttā nāma saṅghikamañcapīṭhādīnaṁ ajjhokāse santharaṇaanāpucchāgamanādīsu āpajjitabbā āpatti, “Connected with one’s own requisites: using an item to be relinquished without first relinquishing it, storing a bowl or robe, not washing a soiled robe, not firing a stained bowl—this is called connected with one’s own requisites. Connected with someone else’s requisites: there is an offense to be committed in leaving without informing after putting a bed or bench belonging to the Sangha out in the open, etc.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.5.eng: There are offenses that are connected with oneself, and offenses that are connected with others. —

pli-tv-pvr7:7.6.pli: Atthi saccaṃ bhaṇanto garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, musā bhaṇanto lahukaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.6.eng: There are heavy offenses committed by one speaking the truth, and light offenses committed by one speaking falsely.

pli-tv-pvr7:7.7.pli: Atthi musā bhaṇanto garukaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, saccaṃ bhaṇanto lahukaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.7.eng: There are heavy offenses committed by one speaking falsely, and light offenses committed by one speaking the truth. —

pli-tv-pvr7:7.8.eng: There are offenses committed by one on the ground, not by one above ground.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.8.comm: Sp 5.322: Saṅghakammaṁ vaggaṁ karissāmīti antosīmāya ekamante nisīdanto bhūmigato āpajjati nāma, “Sitting down to one side within the monastery zone, thinking, ‘I will ensure the legal procedure is done by an incomplete assembly’—it is called ‘committed by one on the ground’.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.9.eng: There are offenses committed by one above ground, not by one on the ground. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.9.comm: Sp 5.322 gives the example of Bu Pc 18:1.18.1.

pli-tv-pvr7:7.10.eng: There are offenses committed by one who is leaving, not by one who is entering.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.10.comm: Sp 5.322 gives the example of the section on “The proper conduct for departing monks” at Kd 18:3.1.0 in The Chapter on Proper Conduct.

pli-tv-pvr7:7.11.eng: There are offenses committed by one who is entering, not by one who is leaving. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.11.comm: Sp 5.322 gives the example of the section on “The proper conduct for newly arrived monks” at Kd 18:0.4 in The Chapter on Proper Conduct.

pli-tv-pvr7:7.12.pli: Atthāpatti ādiyanto āpajjati, atthāpatti anādiyanto āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.12.eng: There are offenses committed by applying, and offenses committed by not applying. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.12.comm: Sp 5.322 gives the examples of Bi Pc 5:1.2.12.1 for the former and Bu Pc 58:1.15.1 for the latter.

pli-tv-pvr7:7.13.pli: Atthāpatti samādiyanto āpajjati, atthāpatti na samādiyanto āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.13.eng: There are offenses committed by undertaking, and offenses committed by not undertaking. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.13.comm: Sp 5.322: Mūgabbatādīni titthiyavattāni samādiyanto samādiyanto āpajjati nāma. Pārivāsikādayo pana tajjanīyādikammakatā vā attano vattaṁ asamādiyantā āpajjanti, te sandhāya vuttaṁ “atthāpatti na samādiyanto āpajjatī”ti, “Undertaking the conduct of ascetics of other religions, such as the vow of silence, etc., is called ‘committed by undertaking’. They commit by not undertaking the conduct of one undertaking probation, etc., who has had a procedure of condemnation, etc., done against them—it is with reference to those that it is said, ‘offenses committed by not undertaking’.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.14.pli: Atthāpatti karonto āpajjati, atthāpatti na karonto āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.14.eng: There are offenses committed by doing, and offenses committed by not doing. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.14.comm: Sp 5.322: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṁ sibbanto vejjakammabhaṇḍāgārikakammacittakammādīni vā karonto karonto āpajjati nāma. Upajjhāyavattādīni akaronto akaronto āpajjati nāma, “Sewing a robe for an unrelated nun or doing the work of a doctor or the work of a storekeeper or the work of a decorator, etc., is called ‘committed by doing’. Not doing the duties of a preceptor, etc., is called ‘committed by not doing’.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.15.pli: Atthāpatti dento āpajjati, atthāpatti na dento āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.15.eng: There are offenses committed by giving, and offenses committed by not giving. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.15.comm: Sp 5.322: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṁ dadamāno dento āpajjati nāma. Saddhivihārikaantevāsikānaṁ cīvarādīni adento adento āpajjati nāma, “Giving a robe to an unrelated nun is called ‘committed by giving’. Not giving robes, etc., to students and pupils is called ‘committed by not giving’.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.16.pli: Atthāpatti desento āpajjati, atthāpatti na desento āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.16.eng: There are offenses committed by teaching, and offenses committed by not teaching. —

pli-tv-pvr7:7.17.pli: Atthāpatti paṭiggaṇhanto āpajjati, atthāpatti na paṭiggaṇhanto āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.17.eng: There are offenses committed by receiving, and offenses committed by not receiving. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.17.comm: Sp 5.322: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṁ gaṇhanto paṭiggaṇhanto āpajjati nāma. “Na bhikkhave ovādo na gahetabbo”ti vacanato ovādaṁ agaṇhanto na paṭiggaṇhanto āpajjati nāma, “Taking a robe from an unrelated nun is called ‘committed by receiving’. Because of the ruling, ‘Monks, you should agree to give the instruction’, then, not agreeing to give the instruction is called ‘committed by not receiving’.” This may seem a bit confusing in English. The idea is that the monk “accepts” the job of giving the instruction. The acceptance, gaṇhāti, is here expressed with the verb paṭigaṇhāti, which normally means “to receive”.

pli-tv-pvr7:7.18.pli: Atthāpatti paribhogena āpajjati, atthāpatti na paribhogena āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.18.eng: There are offenses committed by using, and offenses committed by not using. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.18.comm: Sp 5.322: Nissaggiyavatthuṁ anissajjitvā paribhuñjanto paribhogena āpajjati nāma. Pañcāhikaṁ saṅghāṭicāraṁ atikkāmayamānā aparibhogena āpajjati nāma, “Using an item to be relinquished without first relinquishing it is called ‘committed by using’. Not moving the robes for more than five days is called ‘committed by not using’.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.19.eng: There are offenses committed at night, not by day.

pli-tv-pvr7:7.20.eng: There are offenses committed by day, not at night. —

pli-tv-pvr7:7.21.pli: Atthāpatti aruṇugge āpajjati, atthāpatti na aruṇugge āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.21.eng: There are offenses committed at dawn, and offenses committed not at dawn. —

pli-tv-pvr7:7.22.pli: Atthāpatti chindanto āpajjati, atthāpatti na chindanto āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.22.eng: There are offenses committed by cutting, and offenses committed by not cutting. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.22.comm: Sp 5.322: Bhūtagāmañceva aṅgajātañca chindanto chindanto āpajjati nāma, kese vā nakhe vā na chindanto na chindanto āpajjati nāma, “Cutting plants or the penis is called ‘committed by cutting’. Not cutting the hair or the nails is called ‘committed by not cutting’.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.23.pli: Atthāpatti chādento āpajjati, atthāpatti na chādento āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.23.eng: There are offenses committed by covering, and offenses committed by not covering. —
pli-tv-pvr7:7.23.comm: Sp 5.322: Āpattiṁ chādento chādento āpajjati nāma, “tiṇena vā paṇṇena vā paṭicchādetvā āgantabbaṁ, natveva naggena āgantabbaṁ, yo āgaccheyya āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti imaṁ pana āpattiṁ na chādento āpajjati nāma, “Covering over an offense is called ‘committed by covering’. ‘He should cover up with grass and leaves before going on; he should not go on while naked’—this offense is called ‘committed by not covering’.”

pli-tv-pvr7:7.24.pli: Atthāpatti dhārento āpajjati, atthāpatti na dhārento āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.24.eng: There are offenses committed by wearing, and offenses committed by not wearing.
pli-tv-pvr7:7.24.comm: Sp 5.322: Kusacīrādīni dhārento dhārento āpajjati nāma, “ayaṁ te bhikkhu patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo”ti imaṁ āpattiṁ na dhārento āpajjati nāma, “Wearing grass robes, etc., is called ‘committed by wearing’. ‘Monk, this bowl is yours; keep it until it breaks’—this offense is called ‘committed by not wearing/keeping’.”

pli-tv-pvr7:8.2.eng: the fourteenth and the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.4.eng: the fourteenth and the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.5.eng: There are two kinds of legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.6.eng: the procedure consisting of getting permission, and the procedure consisting of one motion. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.7.eng: There are two other kinds of legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.8.eng: the procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, and the procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.9.eng: There are two kinds of cases of legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.10.eng: the cases of procedures consisting of getting permission, and the cases of procedures consisting of one motion. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.11.eng: There are two other kinds of cases of legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.12.eng: the cases of procedures consisting of one motion and one announcement, and the cases of procedures consisting of one motion and three announcements. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.13.eng: There are two kinds of flaws in legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.14.eng: the flaw in a procedure consisting of getting permission, and the flaw in a procedure consisting of one motion. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.15.eng: There are two other kinds of flaws in legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.16.eng: the flaw in a procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, and the flaw in a procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.17.eng: There are two kinds of successes in legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.18.eng: the success of a procedure consisting of getting permission, and the success of a procedure consisting of one motion. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.19.eng: There are two other kinds of successes in legal procedures:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.20.eng: the success of a procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, and the success of a procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

pli-tv-pvr7:8.21.eng: There are two grounds for belonging to a different Buddhist sect:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.22.pli: attanā vā attānaṃ nānāsaṃvāsakaṃ karoti, samaggo vā naṃ saṅgho ukkhipati adassane vā appaṭikamme vā appaṭinissagge vā.
pli-tv-pvr7:8.22.eng: either one makes oneself belong to a different Buddhist sect, or a unanimous assembly ejects one for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends for an offense, or for not giving up a bad view. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.23.eng: There are two grounds for belonging to the same Buddhist sect:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.24.pli: attanā vā attānaṃ samānasaṃvāsakaṃ karoti, samaggo vā naṃ saṅgho ukkhittaṃ osāreti dassane vā paṭikamme vā paṭinissagge vā.
pli-tv-pvr7:8.24.eng: either one makes oneself belong to the same Buddhist sect, or a unanimous assembly readmits one who has been ejected for recognizing an offense, for making amends for an offense, or for giving up a bad view. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.25.eng: There are two kinds of offenses entailing expulsion:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.27.pli: Dve saṅghādisesā, dve thullaccayā, dve pācittiyā, dve pāṭidesanīyā, dve dukkaṭā, dve dubbhāsitā—
pli-tv-pvr7:8.27.eng: There are two kinds of offenses entailing suspension, two kinds of serious offenses, two kinds of offenses entailing confession, two kinds of offenses entailing acknowledgment, two kinds of offenses of wrong conduct, two kinds of offenses of wrong speech:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.29.eng: There are seven kinds of offenses and seven classes of offenses. —

pli-tv-pvr7:8.30.eng: Schism in the Sangha occurs in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr7:8.31.eng: through a legal procedure or through a vote.

pli-tv-pvr7:9.1.eng: Two kinds of people should not be given the full ordination:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.2.eng: one lacking in age, and one lacking in limbs. —
pli-tv-pvr7:9.2.comm: Sp 5.322: Addhānahīno nāma ūnavīsativasso. Aṅgahīno nāma hatthacchinnādibhedo, “One less than twenty years old is called addhānahīno. The category of one without a hand etc. is called aṅgahīno.”

pli-tv-pvr7:9.3.eng: Another two kinds of people should not be given the full ordination:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.4.eng: one who is deficient as object, and one who has acted wrongly. —
pli-tv-pvr7:9.4.comm: Sp 5.322: Vatthuvipanno nāma paṇḍako tiracchānagato ubhatobyañjanako ca. Avasesā theyyasaṁvāsakādayo aṭṭha abhabbapuggalā karaṇadukkaṭakā nāma, “A paṇḍaka, an animal, and a gynandromorph are called ‘deficient as object’. The remaining eight incapable people, starting with the fake monk, are called ‘one who has acted wrongly’.”

pli-tv-pvr7:9.5.eng: Another two kinds of people should not be given the full ordination:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.6.eng: one who is incomplete, and one who is complete but who has not asked for it. —
pli-tv-pvr7:9.6.comm: Sp 5.322: Aparipūro nāma aparipuṇṇapattacīvaro, “Aparipūro: not complete in bowl and robes.”

pli-tv-pvr7:9.7.eng: One should not live with formal support from two kinds of persons:
pli-tv-pvr7:9.7.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “formal support” for nissāya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr7:9.8.eng: one who is shameless, and one who is ignorant. —

pli-tv-pvr7:9.9.eng: One should not give formal support to two kinds of people:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.10.pli: alajjissa ca lajjino ca na yācati.
pli-tv-pvr7:9.10.eng: one who is shameless, and one who has a sense of conscience but who has not asked for it. —

pli-tv-pvr7:9.11.eng: One should give formal support to two kinds of people:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.12.eng: one who is ignorant, and one who has a sense of conscience and who has asked for it. —

pli-tv-pvr7:9.13.eng: Two kinds of people are incapable of committing an offense:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.15.eng: Two kinds of people are capable of committing an offense:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.17.pli: Dve puggalā abhabbā sañcicca āpattiṃ āpajjituṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:9.17.eng: Two kinds of people are incapable of intentionally committing an offense:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.18.eng: monks and nuns who are noble persons. —

pli-tv-pvr7:9.19.pli: Dve puggalā bhabbā sañcicca āpattiṃ āpajjituṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:9.19.eng: Two kinds of people are capable of intentionally committing an offense:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.20.eng: monks and nuns who are ordinary persons. —

pli-tv-pvr7:9.21.pli: Dve puggalā abhabbā sañcicca sātisāraṃ vatthuṃ ajjhācarituṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:9.21.eng: Two kinds of people are incapable of intentionally committing an action that goes too far:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.22.eng: monks and nuns who are noble persons. —

pli-tv-pvr7:9.23.pli: Dve puggalā bhabbā sañcicca sātisāraṃ vatthuṃ ajjhācarituṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:9.23.eng: Two kinds of people are capable of intentionally committing an action that goes too far:

pli-tv-pvr7:9.24.eng: monks and nuns who are ordinary persons.

pli-tv-pvr7:10.1.eng: There are two kinds of objections:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.2.pli: kāyena vā paṭikkosati vācāya vā paṭikkosati.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.2.eng: one objects by body, or one objects by speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.3.eng: There are two kinds of sending away:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.4.pli: atthi puggalo appatto nissāraṇaṃ tañce saṅgho nissāreti ekacco sunissārito, ekacco dunnissārito.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.4.eng: if the Sangha sends away those who don’t have the attributes needed for being sent away, the sending away of some succeeds, while the sending away of others fails. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.5.eng: There are two kinds of admittance:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.6.pli: atthi puggalo appatto osāraṇaṃ tañce saṅgho osāreti ekacco sosārito, ekacco dosārito.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.6.eng: if the Sangha admits those who don’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, the admittance of some succeeds, while the admittance of others fails. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.7.eng: There are two kinds of admitting:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.8.pli: kāyena vā paṭijānāti vācāya vā paṭijānāti.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.8.eng: one admits by body, or one admits by speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.9.eng: There are two kinds of receiving:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.10.pli: kāyena vā paṭiggaṇhāti kāyapaṭibaddhena vā paṭiggaṇhāti.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.10.eng: one receives by body, or one receives by what is connected to the body. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.11.eng: There are two kinds of prohibitions:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.12.pli: kāyena vā paṭikkhipati vācāya vā paṭikkhipati.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.12.eng: one prohibits by body, or one prohibits by speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.13.eng: There are two kinds of harming:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.14.eng: harming of the training, and harming of possessions. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.15.eng: There are two kinds of accusing:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.16.pli: kāyena vā codeti vācāya vā codeti.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.16.eng: one accuses by body, or one accuses by speech.

pli-tv-pvr7:10.17.eng: There are two obstacles for the ending of the robe season:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.18.eng: the monastery obstacle, and the robe obstacle. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.19.eng: There are two removals of obstacles for the ending of the robe season:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.20.eng: the removal of the monastery obstacle, and the removal of the robe obstacle. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.21.eng: There are two kinds of robes:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.23.eng: There are two kinds of almsbowls:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.25.eng: There are two kinds of bowl rests:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.26.eng: bowl-rests made of tin, and bowl-rests made of lead. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.27.eng: There are two ways of determining an almsbowl:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.28.pli: kāyena vā adhiṭṭheti vācāya vā adhiṭṭheti.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.28.eng: one determines it by body, or one determines it by speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.29.eng: There are two ways of determining a robe:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.30.pli: kāyena vā adhiṭṭheti vācāya vā adhiṭṭheti.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.30.eng: one determines it by body, or one determines it by speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.31.eng: There are two kinds of assignment:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.32.eng: assignment in the presence of, and assignment in the absence of.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.32.comm: For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr7:10.34.eng: for the monks, and for the nuns. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.35.eng: There are two things that belong to the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.36.eng: the rules, and what accords with the rules. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.37.eng: There are two kinds of self-effacement through the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.38.eng: ending access to what is unallowable, and moderation in what is allowable. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.39.eng: One commits an offense in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.40.pli: kāyena vā āpajjati vācāya vā āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.40.eng: one commits it by body, or one commits it by speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.41.eng: One is cleared of an offense in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.42.pli: kāyena vā vuṭṭhāti vācāya vā vuṭṭhāti.
pli-tv-pvr7:10.42.eng: one is cleared by body, or one is cleared by speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.43.eng: There are two kinds of probation:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.44.eng: probation for concealed offenses, and probation for unconcealed offenses. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.45.eng: There are two other kinds of probation:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.47.eng: There are two kinds of trial periods:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.48.eng: trial periods for concealed offenses, and trial periods for unconcealed offenses. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.49.eng: There are two other kinds of trial periods:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.50.eng: trial periods for a half-month, and simultaneous trial periods. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.51.eng: Not counting a day is for two kinds of people:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.52.eng: for one on probation, and for one undertaking the trial period. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.53.eng: There are two kinds of disrespect:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.54.eng: disrespect for the person, and disrespect for the rule.

pli-tv-pvr7:10.55.eng: There are two kinds of salt:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.57.eng: There are two other kinds of salt:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.59.eng: There are two other kinds of salt:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.61.eng: There are two other kinds of salt:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.62.eng: salt from the Roma country, and grain salt. —
pli-tv-pvr7:10.62.comm: Sp-ṭ 5.322: Romajanapade jātaṁ romakaṁ. Pakkālakanti yavakkhāraṁ, “Romaka means grown in the Roma country. Pakkālaka means salt from grain.”

pli-tv-pvr7:10.63.eng: There are two kinds of using:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.64.comm: Sp 5.322: Abbhantaraparibhogo nāma ajjhoharaṇaparibhogo. Bāhiraparibhogo nāma sīsamakkhanādi, “Abbhantaraparibhogo: using for consumption. Bāhiraparibhogo: what can be smeared on the head, etc.”

pli-tv-pvr7:10.65.eng: There are two kinds of name-calling:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.66.pli: hīno ca akkoso ukkaṭṭho ca akkoso.

pli-tv-pvr7:10.67.eng: There is malicious talebearing in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.68.eng: for one wanting to endear himself, or for one aiming at division. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.69.eng: Eating in a group comes about in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.70.eng: through an invitation, or through asking. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.71.eng: There are two entries to the rainy-season residence:

pli-tv-pvr7:10.73.eng: There are two kinds of illegitimate cancellations of the Monastic Code. —

pli-tv-pvr7:10.74.eng: There are two kinds of legitimate cancellations of the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-pvr7:11.1.eng: There are two kinds of fools:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.2.pli: yo ca anāgataṃ bhāraṃ vahati, yo ca āgataṃ bhāraṃ na vahati.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.2.eng: one who takes on future responsibilities, and one who does not take on current responsibilities. —

pli-tv-pvr7:11.3.eng: There are two kinds of wise persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.4.pli: yo ca anāgataṃ bhāraṃ na vahati, yo ca āgataṃ bhāraṃ vahati.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.4.eng: one who does not take on future responsibilities, and one who takes on current responsibilities. —

pli-tv-pvr7:11.5.eng: There are two other kinds of fools:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.6.pli: yo ca akappiye kappiyasaññī, yo ca kappiye akappiyasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.6.eng: one who perceives what is unallowable as allowable, and one who perceives what is allowable as unallowable. —

pli-tv-pvr7:11.7.eng: And there are two kinds of wise persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.8.pli: yo ca akappiye akappiyasaññī, yo ca kappiye kappiyasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.8.eng: one who perceives what is unallowable as unallowable, and one who perceives what is allowable as allowable. —

pli-tv-pvr7:11.9.eng: There are two other kinds of fools:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.10.pli: yo ca anāpattiyā āpattisaññī, yo ca āpattiyā anāpattisaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.10.eng: one who perceives a non-offense as an offense, and one who perceives an offense as a non-offense. —

pli-tv-pvr7:11.11.eng: And there are two kinds of wise persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.12.pli: yo ca āpattiyā āpattisaññī, yo ca anāpattiyā anāpattisaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.12.eng: one who perceives an offense as an offense, and one who perceives a non-offense as a non-offense. —

pli-tv-pvr7:11.13.eng: There are two other kinds of fools:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.14.pli: yo ca adhamme dhammasaññī, yo ca dhamme adhammasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.14.eng: one who perceives what is contrary to the Teaching as the Teaching, and one who perceives what is the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching. —

pli-tv-pvr7:11.15.eng: And there are two kinds of wise persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.16.pli: yo ca adhamme adhammasaññī, yo ca dhamme dhammasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.16.eng: one who perceives what is contrary to the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching, and one who perceives what is the Teaching as the Teaching. —

pli-tv-pvr7:11.17.eng: There are two other kinds of fools:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.18.pli: yo ca avinaye vinayasaññī, yo ca vinaye avinayasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.18.eng: one who perceives what is contrary to the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law, and one who perceives what is the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law. —

pli-tv-pvr7:11.19.eng: And there are two kinds of wise persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:11.20.pli: yo ca avinaye avinayasaññī, yo ca vinaye vinayasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:11.20.eng: one who perceives what is contrary to the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law, and one who perceives what is the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr7:12.1.eng: The corruptions increase for two kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.2.pli: yo ca na kukkuccāyitabbaṃ kukkuccāyati, yo ca kukkuccāyitabbaṃ na kukkuccāyati.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.2.eng: one who is afraid of wrongdoing when one should not be, and one who is not afraid of wrongdoing when one should be. —

pli-tv-pvr7:12.3.eng: The corruptions do not increase for two kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.4.pli: yo ca na kukkuccāyitabbaṃ na kukkuccāyati, yo ca kukkuccāyitabbaṃ kukkuccāyati.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.4.eng: one who is not afraid of wrongdoing when one should not be, and one who is afraid of wrongdoing when one should be. —

pli-tv-pvr7:12.5.eng: The corruptions increase for two other kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.6.pli: yo ca akappiye kappiyasaññī, yo ca kappiye akappiyasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.6.eng: one who perceives what is unallowable as allowable, and one who perceives what is allowable as unallowable. —

pli-tv-pvr7:12.7.eng: The corruptions do not increase for two other kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.8.pli: yo ca akappiye akappiyasaññī, yo ca kappiye kappiyasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.8.eng: one who perceives what is unallowable as unallowable, and one who perceives what is allowable as allowable. —

pli-tv-pvr7:12.9.eng: The corruptions increase for two other kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.10.pli: yo ca anāpattiyā āpattisaññī, yo ca āpattiyā anāpattisaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.10.eng: one who perceives a non-offense as an offense, and one who perceives an offense as a non-offense. —

pli-tv-pvr7:12.11.eng: The corruptions do not increase for two other kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.12.pli: yo ca anāpattiyā anāpattisaññī, yo ca āpattiyā āpattisaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.12.eng: one who perceives a non-offense as a non-offense, and one who perceives an offense as an offense. —

pli-tv-pvr7:12.13.eng: The corruptions increase for two other kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.14.pli: yo ca adhamme dhammasaññī, yo ca dhamme adhammasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.14.eng: one who perceives what is contrary to the Teaching as the Teaching, and one who perceives what is the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching. —

pli-tv-pvr7:12.15.eng: The corruptions do not increase for two other kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.16.pli: yo ca adhamme adhammasaññī, yo ca dhamme dhammasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.16.eng: one who perceives what is contrary to the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching, and one who perceives what is the Teaching as the Teaching. —

pli-tv-pvr7:12.17.eng: The corruptions increase for two other kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.18.pli: yo ca avinaye vinayasaññī, yo ca vinaye avinayasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.18.eng: one who perceives what is contrary to the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law, and one who perceives what is the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law. —

pli-tv-pvr7:12.19.eng: The corruptions do not increase for two other kinds of persons:

pli-tv-pvr7:12.20.pli: yo ca avinaye avinayasaññī, yo ca vinaye vinayasaññī.
pli-tv-pvr7:12.20.eng: one who perceives what is contrary to the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law, and one who perceives what is the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr7:13.1.eng: The section on twos is finished.

pli-tv-pvr7:19.3.eng: Should not live, should not give,

pli-tv-pvr7:21.2.eng: And so two on the robe season;

pli-tv-pvr7:22.2.eng: And belong to the Monastic Law, self-effacement;

pli-tv-pvr7:22.3.eng: And one commits, one is cleared,

pli-tv-pvr7:24.1.eng: And malicious talebearing, group, rainy-season residence,

pli-tv-pvr7:24.3.eng: Non-offense, contrary to the Teaching, the Teaching,

pli-tv-pvr7:24.4.eng: The Monastic Law, and so corruptions.”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.1.pli: Atthāpatti tiṭṭhante bhagavati āpajjati, no parinibbute;
pli-tv-pvr7:25.1.eng: “(1) There are offenses one commits while the Buddha is alive, not after his extinguishment.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.1.comm: Sp 5.323: Tattha lohituppādāpattiṁ tiṭṭhante āpajjati, “Therein, the offense of causing to bleed is committed while he is alive.”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.2.pli: atthāpatti parinibbute bhagavati āpajjati, no tiṭṭhante;
pli-tv-pvr7:25.2.eng: (2) There are offenses one commits after the Buddha’s extinguishment, not while he is alive.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.2.comm: Sp 5.323: Theraṁ āvusovādena samudācaraṇapaccayā āpattiṁ parinibbute bhagavati āpajjati, no tiṭṭhante, “The offense due to addressing a senior monastic as ‘friend’ is committed after the extinguishment of the Buddha, not while he is alive.”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.3.eng: (3) There are offenses one commits both while the Buddha is alive and also after his extinguishment.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.3.comm: Sp 5.323: Imā dve āpattiyo ṭhapetvā avasesā dharantepi bhagavati āpajjati, parinibbutepi, “Apart from these two offenses, the rest are committed both while the Buddha is alive and after the extinguishment.”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.4.eng: (1) There are offenses one commits at the right time, not at the wrong time.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.5.eng: (2) There are offenses one commits at the wrong time, not at the right time.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.6.pli: atthāpatti kāle ceva āpajjati vikāle ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.6.eng: (3) There are offenses one commits both at the right time and also at the wrong time.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.7.eng: (1) There are offenses one commits at night, not by day.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.8.eng: (2) There are offenses one commits by day, not at night.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.9.eng: (3) There are offenses one commits both at night and also by day.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.10.eng: (1) There are offenses one commits when one has ten years of seniority, not less.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.10.comm: Sp 5.323: “Dasavassomhi atirekadasavassomhī”ti bālo abyatto parisaṁ upaṭṭhāpento dasavasso āpajjati no ūnadasavasso, “An ignorant and incompetent person who has ten years of seniority commits an offense when creating an entourage, thinking, ‘I have ten years or more of seniority,’ but not one who has less than ten years of seniority.”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.11.eng: (2) There are offenses one commits when one has less than ten years of seniority, not ten.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.11.comm: Sp 5.323: “Ahaṁ paṇḍito byatto”ti navo vā majjhimo vā parisaṁ upaṭṭhāpento ūnadasavasso āpajjati no dasavasso ca, “A junior monk or one of middle standing who has less than ten years of seniority commits an offense when creating an entourage, thinking, ‘I am wise and competent,’ but not one who has ten years of seniority.”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.12.pli: atthāpatti dasavasso ceva āpajjati ūnadasavasso ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.12.eng: (3) There are offenses one commits both when one has ten years of seniority and also when one has less.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.12.comm: Sp 5.323: Sesā dasavasso ceva āpajjati ūnadasavasso ca, “The rest are committed both by those who have ten years of seniority and by those who have less than ten years of seniority.”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.13.eng: (1) There are offenses one commits when one has five years of seniority, not less.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.13.comm: Sp 5.323: “Pañcavassomhī”ti bālo abyatto anissāya vasanto pañcavasso āpajjati, “An ignorant and incompetent person who has five years of seniority commits an offense when living without formal support, thinking, ‘I have five years of seniority.’”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.14.eng: (2) There are offenses one commits when one has less than five years of seniority, not five.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.14.comm: Sp 5.323: “Ahaṁ paṇḍito byatto”ti navako anissāya vasanto ūnapañcavasso āpajjati, “A junior monk who has less than five years of seniority commits an offense when living without formal support, thinking, ‘I am wise and competent.’”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.15.pli: atthāpatti pañcavasso ceva āpajjati ūnapañcavasso ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.15.eng: (3) There are offenses one commits both when one has five years of seniority and also when one has less.
pli-tv-pvr7:25.15.comm: Sp 5.323: Sesaṁ pañcavasso ceva āpajjati ūnapañcavasso ca, “The rest are committed both by those who have five years of seniority and by those who have less than five years of seniority.”

pli-tv-pvr7:25.16.eng: (1) There are offenses one commits with a wholesome mind.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.17.eng: (2) There are offenses one commits with an unwholesome mind.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.18.eng: (3) There are offenses one commits with an indeterminate mind.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.19.eng: (1) There are offenses one commits while experiencing pleasant feelings.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.20.eng: (2) There are offenses one commits while experiencing unpleasant feelings.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.21.eng: (3) There are offenses one commits while experiencing neither pleasant nor unpleasant feelings.

pli-tv-pvr7:25.22.eng: There are three grounds for an accusation:

pli-tv-pvr7:25.23.eng: what is seen, what is heard, and what is suspected. —

pli-tv-pvr7:25.24.eng: There are three ways of voting:

pli-tv-pvr7:25.25.eng: a secret ballot, an open vote, and whispering in the ear. —

pli-tv-pvr7:25.29.eng: fewness of wishes, contentment, and self-effacement. —

pli-tv-pvr7:25.31.eng: great desires, discontent, and lacking a sense of moderation. —

pli-tv-pvr7:25.33.eng: fewness of wishes, contentment, and having a sense of moderation. —

pli-tv-pvr7:25.34.eng: There are three kinds of rules:

pli-tv-pvr7:25.35.eng: a rule, an addition to a rule, and an unprompted rule. —

pli-tv-pvr7:25.36.eng: There are three other kinds of rules:

pli-tv-pvr7:25.37.eng: a rule that applies everywhere, a rule that applies in a particular place, and a rule that the monks and nuns have in common. —

pli-tv-pvr7:25.38.eng: There are three other kinds of rules:

pli-tv-pvr7:25.39.eng: a rule the monks and nuns do not have in common, a rule for one Sangha, and a rule for both Sanghas.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.1.eng: (1) There are offenses committed by fools, not by the wise.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.2.eng: (2) There are offenses committed by the wise, not by fools.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.3.pli: atthāpatti bālo ceva āpajjati paṇḍito ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.3.eng: (3) There are offenses committed by both by fools and the wise.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.4.eng: (1) There are offenses committed during the waning phase of the moon, not during the waxing phase.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.4.comm: Sp 5.323: Vassaṁ anupagacchanto kāḷe āpajjati no juṇhe, “When not entering the rainy-season residence, one commits an offense during the waning phase of the moon, not during the waxing phase.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.5.eng: (2) There are offenses committed during the waxing phase of the moon, not during the waning phase.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.5.comm: Sp 5.323: Mahāpavāraṇāya appavārento juṇhe āpajjati no kāḷe, “When not inviting during the great invitation ceremony, one commits an offense during the waxing phase of the moon, not during the waning phase.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.6.pli: atthāpatti kāḷe ceva āpajjati juṇhe ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.6.eng: (3) There are offenses committed both during the waning and the waxing phases of the moon.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.6.comm: Sp 5.323: Avasesaṁ kāḷe ceva āpajjati juṇhe ca, “The rest one commits both during the waning and the waxing phases of the moon.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.7.eng: (1) There are things that are allowable during the waning phase of the moon, not during the waxing phase.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.7.comm: Sp 5.323: Vassūpagamanaṁ kāḷe kappati no juṇhe, “Entering the rainy-season residence is allowable during the waning phase of the moon, not during the waxing phase.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.8.eng: (2) There are things that are allowable during the waxing phase of the moon, not during the waning phase.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.8.comm: Sp 5.323: Mahāpavāraṇāya pavāraṇā juṇhe kappati no kāḷe, “Inviting during the great invitation ceremony is allowable during the waxing phase of the moon, not during the waning phase.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.9.pli: atthi kāḷe ceva kappati juṇhe ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.9.eng: (3) There are things that are allowable both during the waning and the waxing phases of the moon.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.9.comm: Sp 5.323: Sesaṁ anuññātakaṁ kāḷe ceva kappati juṇhe ca, “The rest of what is allowable is allowable both during the waning and the waxing phases of the moon.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.10.pli: Atthāpatti hemante āpajjati, no gimhe no vasse;
pli-tv-pvr7:26.10.eng: (1) There are offenses committed during winter, not during summer or the rainy season.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.10.comm: Sp 5.323: Kattikapuṇṇamāsiyā pacchime pāṭipadadivase vikappetvā ṭhapitaṁ vassikasāṭikaṁ nivāsento hemante āpajjati, “Apart from assigning it to another on the day after the observance day of the last Kattika month, if one dresses in the rainy-season bathing cloth, then one commits an offense during winter.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.11.pli: atthāpatti gimhe āpajjati, no hemante no vasse;
pli-tv-pvr7:26.11.eng: (2) There are offenses committed during summer, not during winter or the rainy season.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.11.comm: Sp 5.323: Atirekamāse sese gimhāne pariyesanto atirekaḍḍhamāse sese katvā nivāsento ca gimhe āpajjati nāma, “If one searches when there is more than a month left of summer, or if, after making it, one dresses (in the rainy-season bathing cloth) when there is more than half a month left, then it is called committed during summer.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.12.pli: atthāpatti vasse āpajjati, no hemante no gimhe.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.12.eng: (3) There are offenses committed during the rainy season, not during winter or summer.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.12.comm: Sp 5.323: Satiyā vassikasāṭikāya naggo kāyaṁ ovassāpento vasse āpajjati nāma, “If one has a rainy-season bathing cloth, yet still bathes naked in the rain, then it is called committed during the rainy season.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.13.pli: Atthāpatti saṅgho āpajjati, na gaṇo na puggalo;
pli-tv-pvr7:26.13.eng: (1) There are offenses committed by a sangha, not by several monastics or an individual.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.13.comm: Sp 5.323: Pārisuddhiuposathaṁ vā adhiṭṭhānuposathaṁ vā karonto saṅgho āpajjati, “In doing the observance-day ceremony by declaring one’s purity or by making a determination, a sangha commits an offense.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.14.pli: atthāpatti gaṇo āpajjati, na saṅgho na puggalo;
pli-tv-pvr7:26.14.eng: (2) There are offenses committed by several monastics, not by a sangha or an individual.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.14.comm: Sp 5.323: Suttuddesañca adhiṭṭhānuposathañca karonto gaṇo āpajjati, “In reciting the Monastic Code or doing the observance-day ceremony by making a determination, several monastics commit an offense.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.15.pli: atthāpatti puggalo āpajjati, na saṅgho na gaṇo.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.15.eng: (3) There are offenses committed by an individual, not by a sangha or several monastics.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.15.comm: Sp 5.323: Ekako suttuddesaṁ pārisuddhiuposathañca karonto puggalo āpajjati, “If, on one’s own, one either recites the Monastic Code or does the observance-day ceremony by declaring one’s purity, then the individual commits an offense.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.16.pli: Atthi saṅghassa kappati, na gaṇassa na puggalassa;
pli-tv-pvr7:26.16.eng: (1) There are things allowable for a sangha, not for several monastics or an individual.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.16.comm: Sp 5.323: Saṅghuposatho ca saṅghapavāraṇā ca saṅghasseva kappati, “The observance-day ceremony and the invitation ceremony for a sangha are allowable for a sangha.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.17.pli: atthi gaṇassa kappati, na saṅghassa na puggalassa;
pli-tv-pvr7:26.17.eng: (2) There are things allowable for several monastics, not for a sangha or an individual.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.17.comm: Sp 5.323: Gaṇuposatho ca gaṇapavāraṇā ca gaṇasseva kappati, “The observance-day ceremony and the invitation ceremony for several monastics are allowable for several monastics.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.18.pli: atthi puggalassa kappati, na saṅghassa na gaṇassa.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.18.eng: (3) There are things allowable for an individual, not for a sangha or several monastics.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.18.comm: Sp 5.323: Adhiṭṭhānuposatho ca adhiṭṭhānapavāraṇā ca puggalasseva kappati, “The observance-day ceremony and the invitation ceremony done by making a determination are allowable for an individual.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.19.eng: There are three kinds of concealing:

pli-tv-pvr7:26.20.eng: (1) one conceals the action that was the basis for the offense, not the offense.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.21.eng: (2) one conceals the offense, not the action that was the basis for the offense.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.22.eng: (3) one conceals both the action that was the basis for the offense and also the offense.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.24.eng: (1) a sauna, (2) water, and (3) a cloth.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.24.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “sauna” for jantāghara, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.25.eng: Three things happen concealed, not openly:

pli-tv-pvr7:26.26.eng: (1) Women are married with a veil, not unveiled.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.26.comm: This triplet is a parallel to AN 3.131:1.1, with the difference that the verb there reads āvahati rather than vahati, as here. I follow the reading in the Sutta, which makes better sense.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.27.pli: brāhmaṇānaṃ mantā paṭicchannā vahanti, no vivaṭā;
pli-tv-pvr7:26.27.eng: (2) The mantras of the brahmins are transmitted in secret, not openly.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.28.eng: (3) Wrong view is transmitted in secret, not openly.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.29.eng: Three things shine in the open, not when concealed:

pli-tv-pvr7:26.30.eng: (1) The disc of the moon shines in the open, not when concealed.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.31.eng: (2) The disc of the sun shines in the open, not when concealed.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.32.pli: tathāgatappavedito dhammavinayo vivaṭo virocati, no paṭicchanno.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.32.eng: (3) The spiritual path proclaimed by the Buddha shines in the open, not when concealed.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.32.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “spiritual path” for dhammavinaya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.33.eng: There are three times for the allocation of dwellings:

pli-tv-pvr7:26.34.eng: (1) the first, (2) the second, and (3) when given up in between.

pli-tv-pvr7:26.35.eng: (1) There are offenses that one commits when sick, not when not sick.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.35.comm: Sp 5.323: Aññena bhesajjena karaṇīyena aññaṁ viññāpento gilāno āpajjati, “A sick person commits an offense when asking for a medicine different from the one they need.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.36.eng: (2) There are offenses that one commits when not sick, not when sick.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.36.comm: Sp 5.323: Na bhesajjena karaṇīyena bhesajjaṁ viññāpento agilāno āpajjati, “A person who is not sick commits an offense when asking for a medicine they do not need.”

pli-tv-pvr7:26.37.pli: atthāpatti gilāno ceva āpajjati agilāno ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.37.eng: (3) There are offenses that one commits both when sick and when not sick.
pli-tv-pvr7:26.37.comm: Sp 5.323: Avasesaṁ āpattiṁ gilāno ceva āpajjati agilāno ca, “The rest are committed both by one who is sick and by one who is not.”

pli-tv-pvr7:27.1.eng: There are three kinds of illegitimate cancellations of the Monastic Code. —

pli-tv-pvr7:27.2.eng: There are three kinds of legitimate cancellations of the Monastic Code. —

pli-tv-pvr7:27.3.eng: There are three kinds of probation:

pli-tv-pvr7:27.4.eng: probation for concealed offenses, probation for unconcealed offenses, and purifying probation. —

pli-tv-pvr7:27.5.eng: There are three kinds of trial period:

pli-tv-pvr7:27.6.eng: trial period for concealed offenses, trial period for unconcealed offenses, and trial period for a half-month. —

pli-tv-pvr7:27.7.eng: There are three things that stop a monk on probation from counting a particular day toward his probationary period:

pli-tv-pvr7:27.8.eng: he stays in the same room as a regular monk; he stays apart from other monks; he doesn’t inform other monks of his status.

pli-tv-pvr7:27.9.eng: (1) There are offenses that one commits inside, not outside.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.9.comm: According to Sp 5.323 this refers to Bu Pc 16:1.16.1.

pli-tv-pvr7:27.10.eng: (2) There are offenses that one commits outside, not inside.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.10.comm: According to Sp 5.323 this refers to Bu Pc 14:1.1.9.1.

pli-tv-pvr7:27.11.pli: atthāpatti anto ceva āpajjati bahi ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.11.eng: (3) There are offenses that one commits both inside and outside.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.11.comm: According to Sp 5.323 this refers to the rest of the rules.

pli-tv-pvr7:27.12.eng: (1) There are offenses that one commits inside the monastery zone, not outside.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.12.comm: Sp 5.323: Antosīmāyāti āgantuko āgantukavattaṁ adassetvā sachattupāhano vihāraṁ pavisanto upacārasīmaṁ okkantamattova āpajjati, “Antosīmāya: if a newly arrived monk who does not display the duties of newly arrived monks enters a monastery, or even its vicinity, while holding a sunshade and wearing sandals, then he commits an offense.” For an explanation of the rendering “monastery zone” for sīmā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr7:27.13.eng: (2) There are offenses that one commits outside the monastery zone, not inside.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.13.comm: Sp 5.323: Bahisīmāyāti gamiko dārubhaṇḍapaṭisāmanādigamikavattaṁ apūretvā pakkamanto upacārasīmaṁ atikkantamattova āpajjati, “Bahisīmāya: if a departing monk leaves, or even just goes beyond the vicinity (of the monastery zone), without fulfilling the duties of a departing monk, that is, setting the wooden goods in order, etc., then he commits an offense.”

pli-tv-pvr7:27.14.pli: atthāpatti antosīmāya ceva āpajjati bahisīmāya ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.14.eng: (3) There are offenses that one commits both inside and outside the monastery zone.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.14.comm: Sp 5.323: Avasesaṁ antosīmāya ceva āpajjati bahisīmāya ca, “The rest are committed both inside and outside the monastery zone.”

pli-tv-pvr7:27.15.eng: One commits an offense in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr7:27.16.pli: kāyena āpajjati, vācāya āpajjati, kāyena vācāya āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.16.eng: one commits an offense by body, by speech, or by body and speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:27.17.eng: One commits an offense in three other ways:

pli-tv-pvr7:27.18.eng: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual. —

pli-tv-pvr7:27.19.eng: One clears an offense in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr7:27.20.pli: kāyena vuṭṭhāti, vācāya vuṭṭhāti, kāyena vācāya vuṭṭhāti.
pli-tv-pvr7:27.20.eng: one clears an offense by body, by speech, or by body and speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:27.21.eng: One clears an offense in three other ways:

pli-tv-pvr7:27.22.eng: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual. —

pli-tv-pvr7:27.23.eng: There are three illegitimate grantings of resolution because of past insanity. —

pli-tv-pvr7:27.24.eng: There are three legitimate grantings of resolution because of past insanity.

pli-tv-pvr7:28.1.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-pvr7:28.1.eng: When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:28.2.pli: bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako, bālo hoti abyatto, āpattibahulo anapadāno gihisaṃsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṃsaggehi.
pli-tv-pvr7:28.2.eng: (1) he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha; (2) he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries; (3) he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-pvr7:28.3.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho niyassakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-pvr7:28.3.eng: When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:
pli-tv-pvr7:28.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “demotion” for niyassa, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr7:28.4.pli: bhaṇḍanakārako hoti …pe… saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako, bālo hoti abyatto, āpattibahulo anapadāno gihisaṃsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṃsaggehi.
pli-tv-pvr7:28.4.eng: (1) he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha; (2) he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries; (3) he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-pvr7:28.5.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-pvr7:28.5.eng: When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-pvr7:28.6.pli: bhaṇḍanakārako hoti …pe… saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako, bālo hoti abyatto, āpattibahulo anapadāno kuladūsako hoti pāpasamācāro pāpasamācārā dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:28.6.eng: (1) he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha; (2) he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries; (3) he is a corrupter of families and badly behaved, and his bad behavior has been seen and heard about.

pli-tv-pvr7:28.7.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-pvr7:28.7.eng: When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:28.8.pli: bhaṇḍanakārako hoti …pe… saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako, bālo hoti abyatto, āpattibahulo anapadāno gihī akkosati paribhāsati.
pli-tv-pvr7:28.8.eng: (1) he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha; (2) he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries; (3) he abuses and reviles householders.

pli-tv-pvr7:28.9.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-pvr7:28.9.eng: When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:

pli-tv-pvr7:28.10.pli: bhaṇḍanakārako hoti …pe… saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako, bālo hoti abyatto, āpattibahulo anapadāno āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ passituṃ.
pli-tv-pvr7:28.10.eng: (1) he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha; (2) he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries; (3) after committing an offense, he refuses to recognize it.

pli-tv-pvr7:28.11.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-pvr7:28.11.eng: When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense:

pli-tv-pvr7:28.12.pli: bhaṇḍanakārako hoti …pe… saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako, bālo hoti abyatto, āpattibahulo anapadāno āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ paṭikātuṃ.
pli-tv-pvr7:28.12.eng: (1) he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha; (2) he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries; (3) after committing an offense, he refuses to make amends for it.

pli-tv-pvr7:28.13.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-pvr7:28.13.eng: When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:

pli-tv-pvr7:28.14.pli: bhaṇḍanakārako hoti …pe… saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako, bālo hoti abyatto, āpattibahulo anapadāno na icchati pāpikaṃ diṭṭhiṃ paṭinissajjituṃ.
pli-tv-pvr7:28.14.eng: (1) he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha; (2) he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries; (3) he refuses to give up a bad view.

pli-tv-pvr7:29.1.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho āgāḷhāya ceteyya—
pli-tv-pvr7:29.1.eng: When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, plan a strong action against him:
pli-tv-pvr7:29.1.comm: Sp 5.323: Āgāḷhāya ceteyyāti āgāḷhāya daḷhabhāvāya ceteyya; tajjanīyakammādikatassa vattaṁ na pūrayato icchamāno saṅgho ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyyāti attho, “Āgāḷhāya ceteyya: it may plan what is strong and firm. The meaning is that the Sangha, if it wishes, may do a procedure of ejection against one who is not fulfilling the duties of one who has had a procedure of condemnation, etc., done against him.”

pli-tv-pvr7:29.2.pli: bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako, bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno, gihisaṃsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṃsaggehi.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.2.eng: (1) he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha; (2) he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries; (3) he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-pvr7:29.3.eng: When a monk has three qualities a legal procedure may be done against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:29.4.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.4.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —
pli-tv-pvr7:29.4.comm: Sp 5.425: Apakatattassāti ukkhittakassa vā, yassa vā uposathapavāraṇā ṭhapitā honti , “Not regular: one who has been ejected, or one who has had the recitation of the Monastic Code or the invitation ceremony canceled.”

pli-tv-pvr7:29.5.pli: Aparehipi tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:29.5.eng: When a monk has three other qualities a legal procedure may be done against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:29.6.pli: adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.6.eng: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view. —

pli-tv-pvr7:29.7.pli: Aparehipi tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:29.7.eng: When a monk has three other qualities a legal procedure may be done against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:29.8.pli: kāyikena davena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena davena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena davena samannāgato hoti.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.8.eng: his bodily conduct is frivolous; his verbal conduct is frivolous; his bodily and verbal conduct are frivolous. —
pli-tv-pvr7:29.8.comm: Sp 5.323: Kāyiko davo nāma pāsakādīhi jūtakīḷanādibhedo anācāro; vācasiko davo nāma mukhālambarakaraṇādibhedo anācāro; kāyikavācasiko nāma naccanagāyanādibhedo dvīhipi dvārehi anācāro, “Frivolous bodily conduct: the category of misconduct like gaming and playing, etc., with dice, etc. Frivolous verbal conduct: the category of misconduct like making noises through the mouth, etc. Frivolous bodily and verbal conduct: the category of misconduct through two doors, like dancing and singing, etc.”

pli-tv-pvr7:29.9.pli: Aparehipi tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:29.9.eng: When a monk has three other qualities a legal procedure may be done against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:29.10.pli: kāyikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.10.eng: he is improperly behaved by body; he is improperly behaved by speech; he is improperly behaved by body and speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:29.11.pli: Aparehipi tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:29.11.eng: When a monk has three other qualities a legal procedure may be done against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:29.12.pli: kāyikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.12.eng: his bodily conduct is harmful; his verbal conduct is harmful; his bodily and verbal conduct are harmful. —

pli-tv-pvr7:29.13.pli: Aparehipi tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:29.13.eng: When a monk has three other qualities a legal procedure may be done against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:29.14.pli: kāyikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.14.eng: he has wrong livelihood by body; he has wrong livelihood by speech; he has wrong livelihood by body and speech. —

pli-tv-pvr7:29.15.pli: Aparehipi tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:29.15.eng: When a monk has three other qualities a legal procedure may be done against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:29.16.pli: āpattiṃ āpanno kammakato upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.16.eng: if, after committing an offense and having a legal procedure done against him, he gives the full ordination, gives formal support, has a novice monk attend on him. —

pli-tv-pvr7:29.17.pli: Aparehipi tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:29.17.eng: When a monk has three other qualities a legal procedure may be done against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:29.18.pli: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena kammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.18.eng: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the legal procedure against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the legal procedure against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the legal procedure against him. —

pli-tv-pvr7:29.19.pli: Aparehipi tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:29.19.eng: When a monk has three other qualities a legal procedure may be done against him:

pli-tv-pvr7:29.20.pli: buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.
pli-tv-pvr7:29.20.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr7:30.1.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṃ ṭhapentassa—“alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ mā kalahaṃ mā viggahaṃ mā vivādan”ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho kātabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.1.eng: When a monk has three qualities and is having the observance-day ceremony canceled in the midst of the Sangha, then, after pressing him by saying, ‘Enough, no more arguing and disputing,’ the Sangha should do the observance-day ceremony. These are the three qualities:
pli-tv-pvr7:30.1.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “observance-day ceremony” for uposatha, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr7:30.2.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.2.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.3.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapentassa—“alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ mā kalahaṃ mā viggahaṃ mā vivādan”ti omadditvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.3.eng: When a monk has three qualities and is having the invitation ceremony canceled in the midst of the Sangha, then, after pressing him by saying, ‘Enough, no more arguing and disputing,’ the Sangha should do the invitation ceremony. These are the three qualities:
pli-tv-pvr7:30.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “invitation ceremony” for pavāraṇā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr7:30.4.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.4.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.5.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno na kāci saṅghasammuti dātabbā—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.5.eng: The Sangha should not give any formal approval to a monk who has three qualities:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.6.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.6.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.7.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.7.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he should not speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.8.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.8.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.9.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu na kismiñci paccekaṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.9.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he should not be put in any position of authority:
pli-tv-pvr7:30.9.comm: Sp 5.323: Na kismiñci paccekaṭṭhāneti kismiñci bījanaggāhādike ekasmimpi jeṭṭhakaṭṭhāne na ṭhapetabboti attho, “Na kismiñci paccekaṭṭhāne means he should not be put in any fan-holding position, etc., or in a position of seniority.”

pli-tv-pvr7:30.10.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.10.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.11.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno nissāya na vatthabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.11.eng: When a monk has three qualities, one should not live with formal support from him:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.12.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.12.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.13.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno nissayo na dātabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.13.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he should not give formal support:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.14.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.14.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.15.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa nālaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātuṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.15.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he is not qualified to get permission to correct another:
pli-tv-pvr7:30.15.comm: Sp 5.323: Okāsakammaṁ kārentassāti “karotu āyasmā okāsaṁ, ahaṁ taṁ vattukāmo”ti evaṁ okāsaṁ kārentassa “Okāsakammaṁ kārentassa means asking permission in this way: ‘Venerable, give me permission; I wish to correct you.’”

pli-tv-pvr7:30.16.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.16.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.17.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he should not be allowed to direct anyone:
pli-tv-pvr7:30.17.comm: Sp 5.323: Savacanīyaṁ nādātabbanti vacanaṁ na ādātabbaṁ, vacanampi na sotabbaṁ, “Savacanīyaṁ nādātabba means he should not undertake to correct someone; and even if he does, he should not be listened to.”

pli-tv-pvr7:30.18.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.18.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.19.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno vinayo na pucchitabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.19.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he should not be asked about the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.20.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.20.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.21.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā vinayo na pucchitabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.21.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he should not ask about the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.22.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.22.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.23.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno vinayo na vissajjetabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.23.eng: When a monk has three qualities, his questions about the Monastic Law should not be replied to:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.24.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.24.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.25.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā vinayo na vissajjetabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.25.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he should not reply to questions about the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.26.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.26.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.27.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo na dātabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.27.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he should not be allowed to ask questions:
pli-tv-pvr7:30.27.comm: Sp 5.323: Anuyogo na dātabboti “idaṁ kappatī”ti pucchantassa pucchāya okāso na dātabbo, “aññaṁ pucchā”ti vattabbo. Iti so neva pucchitabbo nāssa pucchā sotabbāti attho, “Anuyogo na dātabbo: when he asks, ‘Is this allowable?’ he should be not be given the opportunity to question. They should say, ‘Ask someone else.’ In this way, he should neither be asked nor should his questions be listened to. This is the meaning.”

pli-tv-pvr7:30.28.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.28.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.29.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ vinayo na sākacchitabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.29.eng: When a monk has three qualities, one should not discuss the Monastic Law with him:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.30.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.30.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk. —

pli-tv-pvr7:30.31.pli: Tīhaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ na nissayo dātabbo na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo—
pli-tv-pvr7:30.31.eng: When a monk has three qualities, he should not give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him:

pli-tv-pvr7:30.32.pli: alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:30.32.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk.

pli-tv-pvr7:31.1.eng: There are three kinds of observance-day ceremonies:

pli-tv-pvr7:31.2.eng: on the fourteenth, on the fifteenth, and the observance-day ceremony for the sake of unity. —

pli-tv-pvr7:31.3.eng: There are three other kinds of observance-day ceremonies:

pli-tv-pvr7:31.4.eng: the observance-day ceremony for a sangha, the observance-day ceremony for a group, and the observance-day ceremony for an individual. —

pli-tv-pvr7:31.5.eng: There are three other kinds of observance-day ceremonies:

pli-tv-pvr7:31.6.eng: the observance-day ceremony which consists of reciting the Monastic Code, the observance-day ceremony which consists of declaring purity, and the observance-day ceremony which consists of a determination.

pli-tv-pvr7:32.1.eng: There are three kinds of invitation ceremonies:

pli-tv-pvr7:32.2.eng: on the fourteenth, on the fifteenth, and the invitation ceremony for the sake of unity. —

pli-tv-pvr7:32.3.eng: There are three other kinds of invitation ceremonies:

pli-tv-pvr7:32.4.eng: the invitation ceremony for a sangha, the invitation ceremony for a group, and the invitation ceremony for an individual. —

pli-tv-pvr7:32.5.eng: There are three other kinds of invitation ceremonies:

pli-tv-pvr7:32.6.eng: the invitation ceremony done by means of three statements, the invitation ceremony done by means of two statements, the invitation ceremony done by means of groups according to the year of seniority.

pli-tv-pvr7:33.1.eng: There are three kinds of persons bound for hell:

pli-tv-pvr7:33.2.pli: idamappahāya, yo ca abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño, yo ca suddhaṃ brahmacāriṃ parisuddhabrahmacariyaṃ carantaṃ amūlakena abrahmacariyena anuddhaṃseti, yo cāyaṃ evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhi—“natthi kāmesu doso”ti so kāmesu pātabyataṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr7:33.2.eng: (1) one who, not having abandoned it, does not abstain from sexuality, while claiming to do so; (2) one who groundlessly charges someone who lives a pure spiritual life with not abstaining from sexuality; (3) one who has and declares a view such as this: ‘There is no fault in worldly pleasures,’ and then indulges in them.

pli-tv-pvr7:33.4.pli: lobho akusalamūlaṃ, doso akusalamūlaṃ, moho akusalamūlaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr7:33.6.pli: alobho kusalamūlaṃ, adoso kusalamūlaṃ, amoho kusalamūlaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr7:33.7.eng: There are three kinds of misconduct:

pli-tv-pvr7:33.8.eng: misconduct by body, misconduct by speech, and misconduct by mind. —

pli-tv-pvr7:33.9.eng: There are three kinds of good conduct:

pli-tv-pvr7:33.10.eng: good conduct by body, good conduct by speech, and good conduct by mind. —

pli-tv-pvr7:33.11.pli: Tayo atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā kulesu tikabhojanaṃ paññattaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr7:33.11.eng: There are three reasons why the Buddha laid down the rule on eating in groups of no more than three:
pli-tv-pvr7:33.11.comm: According to Vmv 4.343 this is a reference to Bu Pc 32:8.15.1.

pli-tv-pvr7:33.12.pli: dummaṅkūnaṃ puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya, “mā pāpicchā pakkhaṃ nissāya saṅghaṃ bhindeyyun”ti kulānuddayatāya ca.
pli-tv-pvr7:33.12.eng: for the restraint of bad people; for the ease of good monks, stopping those with bad desires from creating a faction and then splitting the Sangha; and out of compassion for families. —

pli-tv-pvr7:33.13.pli: Tīhi asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho pāpicchatā pāpamittatā oramattakena visesādhigamena antarā vosānaṃ āpādi.
pli-tv-pvr7:33.13.eng: It’s because he was overcome and consumed by three bad qualities that Devadatta was irredeemably destined to an eon in hell: bad desires; bad friends; and after trifling successes, he stopped short of the goal. —

pli-tv-pvr7:33.14.eng: There are three kinds of approval:

pli-tv-pvr7:33.15.eng: approval to use a staff, approval to use a carrying net, and approval to use both a staff and a carrying net. —

pli-tv-pvr7:33.16.eng: There are three kinds of foot stands that are fixed in place and immobile:

pli-tv-pvr7:33.17.eng: foot stands for defecating, foot stands for urinating, foot stands for restroom ablutions. —

pli-tv-pvr7:33.18.eng: There are three kinds of foot scrubbers:

pli-tv-pvr7:34.1.eng: The section on threes is finished.

pli-tv-pvr7:36.1.eng: “While he is alive, at the right time, and at night,

pli-tv-pvr7:37.2.eng: Fools, and during the waning phase of the moon, it is allowable;

pli-tv-pvr7:37.3.eng: During winter, a sangha, for a sangha,

pli-tv-pvr7:39.1.eng: Inside, and inside the monastery zone,

pli-tv-pvr7:39.4.eng: Two on resolution because of past insanity.

pli-tv-pvr7:40.4.eng: And not giving up a view.

pli-tv-pvr7:41.1.eng: Strong, legal procedure, in the higher morality,

pli-tv-pvr7:42.3.eng: Should not live, should not give,

pli-tv-pvr7:42.4.eng: So one should not ask for permission.

pli-tv-pvr7:43.2.eng: Two on those who should not be asked;

pli-tv-pvr7:43.3.eng: And two on one should not reply,

pli-tv-pvr7:43.4.eng: And one should not be allowed to ask.

pli-tv-pvr7:45.3.eng: Eating in groups of no more than three, in bad qualities,

pli-tv-pvr7:45.6.eng: This is the summary for the threes.”

pli-tv-pvr7:46.1.eng: (1) There are offenses that one commits through one’s own speech, but clears through someone else’s speech.
pli-tv-pvr7:46.1.comm: Sp 5.324: Sakavācāya āpajjati paravācāya vuṭṭhātīti vacīdvārikaṁ padasodhammādibhedaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjitvā tiṇavatthārakasamathaṭṭhānaṁ gato parassa kammavācāya vuṭṭhāti, “One commits through one’s own speech, but clears through someone else’s speech: having committed an offense in the category of memorizing the teaching, etc., through the speech door, one goes to the place where it can be settled by covering over as if with grass, and one then clears it through someone else’s legal-procedure announcement.”

pli-tv-pvr7:46.2.eng: (2) There are offenses that one commits through someone else’s speech, but clears through one’s own speech.
pli-tv-pvr7:46.2.comm: Sp 5.324: Paravācāya āpajjati sakavācāya vuṭṭhātīti pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge parassa kammavācāya āpajjati, puggalassa santike desento sakavācāya vuṭṭhāti, “One commits through someone else’s speech, but clears through one’s own speech: having committed an offense through someone else’s legal-procedure announcement in regard to not giving up a bad view, one clears it through one’s own speech by confessing in the presence of an individual.”

pli-tv-pvr7:46.3.eng: (3) There are offenses that one commits through one’s own speech and clears through one’s own speech.
pli-tv-pvr7:46.3.comm: Sp 5.324: Sakavācāya āpajjati sakavācāya vuṭṭhātīti vacīdvārikaṁ padasodhammādibhedaṁ āpattiṁ sakavācāya āpajjati, desetvā vuṭṭhahantopi sakavācāya vuṭṭhāti, “One commits through one’s own speech and clears through one’s own speech: having committed, through one’s own speech, an offense in the category of memorizing the teaching, etc., through the speech door, one clears it through one’s own speech by confessing in the presence of an individual.”
